org.gbif.api.util

Class SearchTypeValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gbif.api.util.SearchTypeValidator

  • public class SearchTypeValidator
extends Object
    Utility class to do basic validation of all search enum based values.

      • buildRange

        public static <T extends Comparable<?>> com.google.common.collect.Range<T> buildRange(T lower,
                                                                      T upper)
        Builds a closed range from two given values, but accepts nulls which are converted into unbound ranges in the guava instance.

      • isRange

        public static boolean isRange(String value)
        Determines whether the value given is a valid decimal or date range, delimiting two values by a comma.
        Returns:
        true if the given value is a valid range

      • parseDateRange

        public static com.google.common.collect.Range<Date> parseDateRange(String value)
        Parses a range of ISO dates. The date format used is the first date format that successfully parses the lower range limit.
        Returns:
        the parsed range with wildcards represented as null values
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if value is invalid or null

      • parseDecimalRange

        public static com.google.common.collect.Range<Double> parseDecimalRange(String value)
        Parses a decimal range in the format 123.1,456.
        Returns:
        the parsed range with wildcards represented as null values
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if value is invalid or null

      • parseIntegerRange

        public static com.google.common.collect.Range<Integer> parseIntegerRange(String value)
        Parses an integer range in the format 123,456
        Returns:
        the parsed range with wildcards represented as null values
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if value is invalid or null

      • validate

        public static void validate(SearchParameter param,
            String value)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Validates that a given parameter value matches the expected type of the parameter as defined by SearchParameter.type() and throws an IllegalArgumentException otherwise.
        Parameters:
        param - the search parameter defining the expected type
        value - the parameter value to be validated
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the value cannot be converted to the expected type
